特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
This course is currently planned for face-to-face format. Every content lesson will be based on an academic English reading (usually 8 - 15 pages) and consist of an in-person lecture supported by PowerPoint slides and student notetaking. Three lessons will be designated for Unit Tests, and the final lesson will be designated for course review and completion of the Final Writing Assignment.

All course reading and handout materials will be distributed to students via the course LUNA site. Students are expected to access and use electronic course materials on their own. No printed materials will be provided.

[Information for students permitted to take classes online]
Only students who cannot enter Japan may be permitted by the university to take this course online. Data recorded from face-to-face classes will be broadcast on-demand. Links to the recorded lectures will be provided on the course LUNA site. Students permitted to take classes online are expected to watch on-demand lectures and complete the required assessments according to the course schedule.

第1回:
*All sessions are planned for face-to-face format.
Course introduction
第7回: Is language learning possible at school?
第8回: Models of teaching and learning English
第10回: World Englishes in English as an International Language (EIL)
第12回: The future of English as a global language
第14回: Review course materials and complete the Final Writing Assignment
トピック.授業計画1: Most weekly sessions will follow a similar pattern. Students will carefully read an academic English text, attend the in-person lecture, and take notes. Three sessions are designated to complete the three Unit Tests. Instead of a course Final Exam, students will complete the Final Writing Assignment in the last session.
